ygData.subject: EQ On the Brain [OT]
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey, Slyde. Perfect name for your bard. ;)  I play T-Bone in RL as well (if my e-mail address didn t give it away). Q: What s the definition of an optimist? A:
ygData.messageBody:
Hey, Slyde. Perfect name for your bard. ;) I play T-Bone in RL as well (if
my e-mail address didn't give it away).

Q: What's the definition of an optimist?
A: A trombonist with a resume

What kinda axe you got? Me - New Bach 36B with open-wrap F-attachment. Also
have a 30 yr. old Conn 88H with red brass bell. And, of course, my original
Bundy pea-shooter. :p

Operaman Overtone
24th position
<Spirit of the Moon>
Innoruuk


From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...>

I guess this can be on the list of - you know you're playing too much
Everquest when...

Was playing in one of my bands last night - where they need to balance
the solos between the three horns better - most of the solos go to the
baritone sax (go figure)..

So anyway - we get a new version of a tune and instead of all three
horns getting solos - there are only two (for me - trombone and the alto
sax) and I think to myself "Wow, they nerfed the baritone part..."

Slyde
